data.title: Write the date in Latin
data.statement:
Given a day number in July, write the corresponding date in Latin.

The rules to write a date in Latin are as follows.

<<If it's a special day, just write its name:>>
- July 1st --> {{Kal Iul}};
- July 7th --> {{Non Iul}};
- July 15th --> {{Eid Iul}} ;
- August 1st --> {{Kal Aug}}.

<<If it's the day just before a special day:>>
--> {{prid}} [[special_day]]
where [[special day]] is the name of the special day.

<<Other days:>>
--> {{a d }}[[k+1]] [[special_day]]
where [[k]] is the number of days until the next special day, written in Roman numerals, and [[special_day]] is the name of that special day.

Only Roman numerals 3 to 17 are needed for this task. A list of Roman numerals is provided in comment.

The word {{Iul}} is "iul" with an upercase i, not "Lul" with a lowercase L.

testCases.title: Special days
testCases.testOut:
Kal Iul
Non Iul
Eid Iul

testCases.title: Special days
testCases.testOut:
Kal Iul
Eid Iul
Non Iul

testCases.title: The day before
testCases.testOut:
prid Non Iul
prid Eid Iul
prid Kal Aug

testCases.title: The day before
testCases.testOut:
prid Eid Iul
prid Non Iul
prid Kal Aug

testCases.title: Kalendae to Nonae
testCases.testOut:
a d VI Non Iul
a d V Non Iul
a d IV Non Iul
a d III Non Iul

testCases.title: Kalendae to Nonae
testCases.testOut:
a d VI Non Iul
a d IV Non Iul
a d III Non Iul
a d V Non Iul

testCases.title: Nonae to Eidus
testCases.testOut:
a d VIII Eid Iul
a d VII Eid Iul
a d VI Eid Iul
a d V Eid Iul
a d IV Eid Iul
a d III Eid Iul

testCases.title: Nonae to Eidus
testCases.testOut:
a d VI Eid Iul
a d VIII Eid Iul
a d VII Eid Iul
a d IV Eid Iul
a d V Eid Iul
a d III Eid Iul

testCases.title: Eidus to Kalendae
testCases.testOut:
a d XVII Kal Aug
a d XVI Kal Aug
a d XV Kal Aug
a d XIV Kal Aug
a d XIII Kal Aug
a d XII Kal Aug
a d XI Kal Aug
a d X Kal Aug
a d IX Kal Aug
a d VIII Kal Aug
a d VII Kal Aug
a d VI Kal Aug
a d V Kal Aug
a d IV Kal Aug
a d III Kal Aug

testCases.title: Eidus to Kalendae
testCases.testOut:

a d X Kal Aug
a d XVI Kal Aug
a d XVII Kal Aug
a d XII Kal Aug
a d V Kal Aug
a d XIV Kal Aug
a d VIII Kal Aug

a d XIII Kal Aug

STATEMENT
Roman numerals 1 to 20:
I II III IV V VI VII VIII IX X XI XII XIII XIV XV XVI XVII XVIII XIX XX
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> The number [[n]] of days.
<<Line 2:>> A list of [[n]] space-separated day numbers [[d]].
data.outputDescription: <<[[n]] lines:>> The name of this day in July, written in Latin, one day per line.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Given a day number in July, write the corresponding date in Latin.

The rules to write a date in Latin are as follows.

If it's a special day, just write its name:
- July 1st --> Kal Iul;
- July 7th --> Non Iul;
- July 15th --> Eid Iul ;
- August 1st --> Kal Aug.

If it's the day just before a special day:
--> prid special_day
where special day is the name of the special day.

Other days:
--> a d k+1 special_day
where k is the number of days until the next special day, written in Roman numerals, and special_day is the name of that special day.

Only Roman numerals 3 to 17 are needed for this task. A list of Roman numerals is provided in comment.

The word Iul is "iul" with an upercase i, not "Lul" with a lowercase L.
Input
Line 1: The number n of days.
Line 2: A list of n space-separated day numbers d.
Output
n lines: The name of this day in July, written in Latin, one day per line.
Constraints
1 ≤ n ≤ 20
1 ≤ d ≤ 31
Example
Input
1
5
Output
a d III Non Iul
